column2: lisalisa41, 35-44 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 6yr old has Autism and can be very hyper. I was given Tenex 1m, he was to take 1/2 3xs a day! It was to much so i gave him 1/2 once a day only at bed time and OMG! This medicine made my child into someone i dont even know! He's showing symptoms of ocd and very paranoid His eye's twitch constantly and he seems trapped in his body and cant get out. I can't stop crying! He will never take this medicine again!

Please note that I take a tremendous amount of other RX's - perhaps made a difference re:  side effects.  ??

column2: mamax8, 3-6 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 6yr old daughter has been taking this medication for 1wk for her ADHD. If she isn't asleep she's crying. And screaming for hours. She was on a stimulant(Vyvanse) her therapist said Tenex would work better due to her severity of ADHD she was prescribed 1mg in the am and 1mg in the afternoon. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After the first night time dose I felt severely sedated ALL day the following day from just 1mg. I took it 10pm and didn't wake until 3pm the next day except to go to the bathroom even after that I was still groggy all day. I was on 6 BP drugs before starting on Tenex so that probably has something to do with it. I am now prsently getting evaluated to get Renal artery nerve ablation at Edward hosp. in Naperville Il. I have never been as sedated as I was with any other drug as Tenex,I hate it.

column2: colemicheleb@yahoo.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have severe PTSD. I was taking 3 benzos ( valium, Klonopin and lorazepam) plus ambien for sleep. I still did not sleep at all plus i was addicted to the medications. When i decided to go off of all narcotics my doctor was reluctant to dc the meds due to my severe PTSD, i sought help froma different doctor. This new doctor prescribed me tenex and told me he used it off label as a blocker of adrenaline to help with the PTSD, i wasnt quite sure how a blood pressure med would help with PTSD but it makes perfect sense, with PTSD we have a fight or flight reaction to situations, horrible nightmare and lack of sleep, the fight or flight syndrome causes an adrenaline rush so the medication blocks that arenaline. I have never slept better than I do now, this drug is a wonder. I have not had 1 side effect, I no longer have to rely on narcotics, i was deemed disabled due to the PTSD and now I am working, enjoying life and functioning. I also have to see a psychologist in conjuction with the medication but it is so wonderful to sleep again.

column2: Misses, 3-6 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 5 year old son has anxiety, ODD, and ADHD.  Our biggest concern is the ODD.  We tried this medication for a week and worked for ADHD.  He did his hmk by himself!  But...he became even more irritable and aggressive!  So this medication had the opposite intended effect.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I filled this out for my grandson who is 3 years old. What a disaster the bot is so constipated he has been in the er 2 times in a week. nothing helps him. I personally do not believe in medicating children and I believe that sometimes doctor's hand out med's like they are candy. Maybe the doctor should have to sit and listen to him cry because his little belly hurts so bad and he is vomitting because he is so plugged up!

column2: A.M.Y., 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This was prescribed as a supplement to my 5-yr-old's ADHD medicine (Concerta 27mg); in less than a week (maybe 3 or 4 days), he got incredibly aggressive and tantrums skyrocketed to an all-time high. He also claimed that his "hands were out of control". The doctor and I were in complete agreement, and we pulled him off of it. It was only a 1 mg dose once a day around lunchtime, but once we pulled him off of it the aggression abruptly disappeared as quickly as it had come. We won't be using it again anytime soon... And I hope the FDA periodically reads these reviews, so hopefully they know that this is a possibility with this medicine, at least in young children..

column2: coasties99, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: Our children are adopted & along with all 4 of them having ADHD they have much anxiety & other mood & mental illness's.  2 of my kids are on this med & they are putting our other son on now.  Hardest part is not knowing which disorder is acting up to judge which meds are working or not.  I like the fact it's a non-stimulant & used for anxiety/mood stabilizing along w/ADHD.

column2: on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

column9: My 5 year old son was recently put on this for his ADHD and it has helped him so much. We noticed the difference in him within a week of starting this medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My 18 yr old daughter, our youngest, has been taking this drug along with Concerta for over 10 years. It has helped her tremendously! It made a difference immediately. She was able to focus better and helped her stop throwing temper tantrums every time she didn't get her own way. She started out taking 1/4 of 1mg tablet and is now taking 1 1mg tablet at bedtime. I am a mother of 3 children; 2 w/ADHD and 1 w/ADD and all took ritalin to begin with and are now on Concerta. Their doctor monitored their weight, height and blood pressure to make sure they were where they should be for their age. We make sure our children eat before taking the medication so there is a minimal loss of appetite. We have also taught them that medication isn't the answer for everything and not to go through life thinking a pill is going to solve their problems! Parents, be cautious and research everything. Talk to your doctor before you give your children anything! When my children started a new medication or dosage change-I did it on the weekend so I could monitor if there were any side effects! And never ever, give your child more than what the physician has prescribed! If your child seems spaced out-call your doctor immediately! The dosage may need to be adjusted or changed or stopped altogether! People think kids who take medication act like they are drugged or spaced out. People don't know my children take medication unless I tell them and most of the time, they don't believe me! Medication doesn't work for everyone, but it has worked for mine.

column2: Mom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column2: TacM, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Tenex for several years for my Tourette Syndrome and ADHD. The dosages have increased so now I take 3 pills 3 times per day. The only side effects I've experienced are slight drowsiness and slight dizziness on occasion.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 14 month old son was started on Tenex to help control his tics due to mild Tourettes. We have noticed a severe drop in the amount of tics he has had in just the last 6 days he has been on it. I was not aware of how rapidly this helps.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter is 16 years old and has,in the past year,been diagnosed with ADD. She also has mild tourettes. It has helped her performance in school amazingly, but has had little effect on her tics. It also helps her outside of class, in social situations homework, etc. She takes 1mg, and has fluctuated between 1 and 1 1/2, but the 1 1/2 makes her tired. If she is forseeing problems, she takes 1 1/4 for a few days. Definitely worth a try!

column2: HannahzMom, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 9-yr old daughter has Early-Onset Bipolar Disorder with comorbid ADHD. We have been through MANY medications in the last 6 years.  She is on Seroquel and when the Tenex was added, we noticed a significant reduction in the anxiety and it seems to have slowed the "super-rapid-cycling" she goes through. SHE is actually happier about the way she feels.

column2: 3-6 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: my 5 y/o son has been taking tenex in combination with ritalin LA for 3 months. the ritalin alone had no effect, however when we added the tenex (0.5 mg in the morning) he began to excell in school , at home, and behave elsewhere. i have little to no behavior problems and my son is much happier. he is able to make friends as his adhd was so severe that other children avoided him. this has also helped him sit still, listen, and be aware enough to know what's going on around him. The only side affect we noticed in the beginning was loss of appetite. THIS IS NOT A WONDER DRUG! WE ALSO PROVIDED MY SON WITH RULES, SRTUCTURE, AND BEHAVIOR ANALYSIS THERAPY!

column2: Amateur Parent, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My 8 yo daughter has been on Tenex for over a year.  She has Tourette's Syndrome, ADHD, and OCD.  We have had no side effects .. Just less tics. It has been an inexpensive medication with great results.

My 7 yr ofd son is described as ADHD ODD and Mood Disorder NOS.  After trying many other things, this is the best result for us so far.  He did get very drowsy in the beginning.  We backed down and only use 3/4 mg 3times/day and made increases very gradually.
